channel.title: 317 starter
channel.description: Okay well i was coding this server for my friend, and while i was doing that i got into a little bit of a snag. Anyways he didnt want a starter, i mean like when u log on u log in with items already. Instead he was a ::starter command i alreadty got rid of the starter when you log in. but i have no idea how to make a ::starter command. and why u do ::starter lets say u get like 10m. and now that u have recieved ur started u cant do it again. if u no what i mean

item.title: 317 starter
item.dc:creator: @DreamCream DreamCream
item.description:
@DreamCream wrote:

Please don’t grave dig…
And if your saying you want the player to be wearing the items as he logs in… Try…
c.getItems().wearItem(14484, SLOTID);
If you have any question’s make a new thread… Don’t grave dig…

Read full topic

Aint you got this part a little wrong?

starter == 1;

Isn’t it soposed to be like this:

starter = 1;

item.title: 317 starter
item.dc:creator: @mlgsnipe mlgsnipe
item.description:
@mlgsnipe wrote:

wait so the command would be like this?

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("starter") { if(starter == 0) { addItem(ID, AMOUNT); addItem(ID, AMOUNT); addItem(ID, AMOUNT); addItem(ID, AMOUNT); addItem(ID, AMOUNT); addItem(ID, AMOUNT); addItem(ID, AMOUNT); addStarter(); sM("You have received your starter kit."); } else { sM("You have already received your starter kit."); } }

Read full topic

item.title: 317 starter
item.dc:creator: @illslayu illslayu
item.description:
@illslayu wrote:

OFL - OnFloorLaughing (No rolling tho :D)

The command atm gives items if the “starter” value is EQUAL or BIGGER than 0.

Correction:

if (command.startsWith("boob") && starter <=0 {

And also make sure that:

  1. Command includes setting “starter” value to 1.
  2. “starter” value is saved in the character file.

Read full topic
